sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
What number should be subtracted from each of the numbers \(7 \), \(14 \), and \(23 \) to make the reminders be in continued proportion.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "$$\text{Lets suppose that the required number is $y $.

Since the numbers $7 - y $, $\input[s1v1]{} - y $, $23 - y $, are in proportion, we have}$$
\[
	\frac{7 - y }{14 - y } = \frac{14 - y }{23 - y }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow (\input[s2v1]{} - y )(23 - y ) = (14 - y )(14 - y )
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \input[s3v1]{} - y (30 ) + y ^2 = 196 - y (28 ) + y ^2
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow y(\input[s4v1]{} - 30 ) = 196 - 161 
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow y = \frac{\input[s5v1]{} - 161 }{28 - 30 }
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow y = \frac{\input[s6v1]{} }{-2 }
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow y = \frac{\input[s7v1]{} }{2 }
\]"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [14], "text": "$$\text{Suppose the required number that needs to be subtracted from each given number is y. Then, the new set of numbers would be $7 - y $, $14 - y $, $23 - y $,. Since these numbers are in continued proportion, we can write:$\frac{7 - y }{14 - y } = \frac{14 - y }{23 - y }$}$$ "}, {"data": [7], "text": "$$\text{ Cross-multiplying the above equation, we get: $ (7 - y )(23 - y ) = (14 - y )(14 - y ) $}$$"}, {"data": [161], "text": "$$\text{Expanding the above equation, we get: $ 161 - y (30 ) + y ^2 = 196 - y (28 ) + y ^2$}$$ "}, {"data": [28], "text": "$$\text{ Bringing all the common terms on one side, we get: $y (28 - 30 ) = 196 - 161$}$$"}, {"data": [196], "text": "$$\text{Further simplification will get us this equation $y = \frac{196 - 161 }{28 - 30 }$}$$ "}, {"data": [35], "text": "$$\text{Upon further arithmetic calculation, we achieve this: $y = \frac{35 }{-2 }$}$$ "}, {"data": [-35], "text": "$$\text{Our final result would be $y = \frac{-35 }{2 }$}$$ "}]
